column1: Appendix Table 2. Estimates of employment in all government functions and the total justice system and estimates for figure 2: Full-time equivalent employees in justice system functions in state and local governments, 1997-2017
Report title: Justice Expenditures and Employment in the United States, 2017 NCJ 256093
Data source: U.S. Census Bureau, Census of Governments, 1997-2017
Author: Emily D. Buehler, Ph.D., BJS Statistician

Appendix Table 2. Estimates of employment in all government functions and the total justice system and estimates for figure 2: Full-time equivalent employees in justice system functions in state and local governments, 1997-2017
Note: Full-time equivalent (FTE) is the number of full-time employees, plus the number of paid part-time hours divided by the standard hours for full-time employees in a government.
*Police protection employees can be classified as either sworn (having arrest powers) or nonsworn (all others).
Source: U.S. Census Bureau,  Census of Governments, 1997-2017.
